metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14491 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in dnsmasq before 2.78 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via a crafted DNS response.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dnsmasq - 2.68-1ubuntu0.2
dnsmasq-base - 2.68-1ubuntu0.2
dnsmasq-utils - 2.68-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Felix Wilhelm, Fermin J. Serna, Gabriel Campana and Kevin Hamacher

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.68-1ubuntu0.2').
